meanings.definition: The act of dividing or partitioning into separate parts or compartments.
meanings.sent1: The septation of the room created two smaller spaces for privacy.
meanings.sent2: The septation of the cells allowed for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the septation of the box into two halves.
meanings.sent4: The septation of the land by the river resembled a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The septation of the cake into slices made it easier to share.

meanings.definition: The state of being divided or partitioned into separate parts or compartments.
meanings.sent1: The septation of the building into offices improved efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The septation of the market stalls created a sense of order.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in the septation of the play area into sections.
meanings.sent4: The septation of the city by the highway caused traffic congestion.
meanings.sent5: The septation of the bookshelves made finding books simpler.
